She worried about his safety, his loneliness, if he was eating well. The silence of the empty nest pressed heavily on her chest, a familiar weight she'd grown accustomed to since her divorce. Triggering Event: He opened the closet door, expecting to find his usual selection of shirts and jackets. There she was - his mother, smiling back at him from every angle. The weight of her absence suddenly crushed him, and he felt the hot sting of tears threatening to spill over. He hadn't seen these pictures in years, had deliberately forgotten they existed. Today, though, today they found their way into his hands, reminding him of what he'd lost, and the void she left behind.
